content: Singaporean politician **Raymond Lim Siang Keat** ([Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters): 林双吉; [pinyin](/wiki/Pinyin): *Lín Shuāngjí*, born 24 June 1959) is a Singaporean former politician. A member of the governing [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) (PAP), Lim was a [Member of Parliament](/wiki/Member_of_Parliament) (MP) representing the [East Coast Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/East_Coast_Group_Representation_Constituency) for Fengshan from 2001 to 2015. He served as the [Minister for Transport](/wiki/Minister_for_Transport_(Singapore)) from 2006 to 2011, and as a Minister in the [Prime Minister's Office](/wiki/Prime_Minister%27s_Office_(Singapore)) from 2005 to 2006. When taking on the transport portfolio, he was informed by [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) that this was a "thankless job" but that "someone has to do it". He retired from politics in 2015 and is presently Executive Chairman of APS Asset Management and Senior Advisor to the [Swire Group](/wiki/Swire_Group). ## Education Lim was a [Rhodes Scholar](/wiki/Rhodes_Scholar) and [Colombo Plan](/wiki/Colombo_Plan) scholar and holds degrees from the universities of [Adelaide](/wiki/University_of_Adelaide), [Oxford](/wiki/University_of_Oxford) and [King's College, Cambridge](/wiki/King%27s_College,_Cambridge) (LLM, 1987). Prior to his university education, he was a student and athlete in [Raffles Institution](/wiki/Raffles_Institution_(Secondary)). Before taking on political office, he held numerous positions in the financial industry which he joined after serving as a law lecturer at the [National University of Singapore](/wiki/National_University_of_Singapore) and working as a reporter at *[The Straits Times](/wiki/The_Straits_Times)*. ## Personal life Lim's brother, [Benny Lim Siang Hoe](/wiki/Benny_Lim_Siang_Hoe), was with the [Internal Security Department](/wiki/Internal_Security_Department_(Singapore)), and is also a former Permanent Secretary at the [Ministry of National Development](/wiki/Ministry_of_National_Development_(Singapore)).
